titleStmt.title: Thomas E. Bramlette, Agent, Moses Cook
CWG1144

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Requisitions for the Return of Fugitives from Justice, 1863-1867

body.p:
IN THE NAME AND BY THE AUTHORITY OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF KENTUCKY,
KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL
THOMAS E. BRAMLETTE,
GOVERNOR OF SAID COMMONWEALTH.
TO ALL WHOM THESE PRESENTS SHALL COME, GREETING:

Know Ye, That reposing especial trust and confidence in the integrity, diligence, and ability of Moses Cook, I do hereby appoint him Agent, On the part of this State, to proceed to the State of Wisconsin for the purpose of demanding and receiving from the proper authorities of said State, Claudius Tift, a Fugitive from Justice from the State of Kentucky, charged with Felony; and I do hereby authorize and direct the said Moses Cook to demand and receive the said Fugitive, bring him to this State, and deliver him to the custody of the Jailor of the County of Campbell Co' Ky.

figure.ab:
SEAL OF KENTUCKY
UNITED WE STAND DIVIDED WE FALL

body.p: In Testimony Whereof, I have caused these letters to be made patent, and the Seal of the Commonwealth to be hereunto affixed. Done at Frankfort, the 17th day of November, in the year of our Lord one thousand eight hundred and sixty-5, and in the seventy-fourth year of the Commonwealth.

Thos E Bramlette
By the Governor: E. L. VanWinkle, Secretary of State.
By Jas R. Page
Asst Secty
GEORGE D. PRENTICE, STATE PRINTER.
